Resources

Submission and Delivery Deadlines

How does Meenta manage your sample? Below is a diagram of the timeline of events that will impact your sample.

Order Date

This is the date you placed your order.

Cancellation Period

Within 48 hours of the Order Date, either the User or the Host can cancel for any reason.

Sample Arrival Date

The sample must arrive at the Host two days before the Run Date.

Run Date

This is the date when your sample will start on the instrument.

Data Delivery

Ten days after the Run Date your data is available to download.

Cancelation Policy

In the first 48 hours after a purchase a sample order can be cancelled, with a full refund. After the 48 hour period, a sample will be charged.

Late Sample Arrival

If a sample arrives late, after the Sample Arrival Date, the user will be charged a 10% fee. Why a fee? The Host will need to reschedule your sample and potentially delay another User's samples.

Late Fees

Timely delivery of samples by Users reduces the chances that any one late sample could potentially delay another User's run on the same instrument. Similarly, timely delivery of data by Hosts reduces the chance that any given User's projects' deadlines are missed.

Late Data Delivery

If the host does not deliver sample data by teh Data Delivery date, then Meenta assesses the host a 10% fee.
